intro: Tithymaloides, commonly known as the false tithymale, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that typically feature yellow ray florets and a central disk of tubular flowers. The plants are native to southern Africa and are often found in grasslands and rocky areas. They have slender, branching stems and linear to lance-shaped leaves. Tithymaloides species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens for their vibrant blooms.
